conclusion: The problem involves determining how the shadows (A, B, C, and D) of four objects change in position and size when the light source moves downward.
The image shows four objects: an ice cream sundae, a typewriter, a fruit, and a cylindrical object with a triangular prism on top. Each object casts a shadow labeled A, B, C, and D, respectively.
The shadows (A, B, C, and D) are cast on the ground and are positioned away from the bases of their respective objects.
When the light source is lowered, all four shadows (A–D) will move farther away from the bases of their objects in the direction opposite the lamp.
When the light source is lowered, all four shadows (A–D) will get larger (longer/wider).
No other unexpected changes occur; the ordering of the objects and their relative shadow shapes stay the same.
